case_title: M/S. PIONEER STEEL MILLS LIMITED, LAHORE vs COLLECTORATE OF SALES TAX, LAHORE
appellant: M/S. PIONEER STEEL MILLS LIMITED, LAHORE
key_issues: Sales tax liability on goods supplied to Azad Jammu and Kashmir
Applicability of Sales Tax Act, 1990 to Azad Jammu and Kashmir
Compliance with Customs Act, 1969 for export procedures

contentions: Azad Jammu and Kashmir is not part of Pakistan and constitutes a foreign territory.
Goods supplied to Azad Jammu and Kashmir are zero-rated exports under Sections 3 and 4 of the Sales Tax Act, 1990.
Non-applicability of penal provisions of the Sales Tax Act, 1990.
Sales tax is leviable under the Sales Tax Act, 1990 even for goods supplied to Azad Jammu and Kashmir.
Azad Jammu and Kashmir is not a foreign territory.
No legal formalities for export were completed.

findings: Azad Jammu and Kashmir is legally considered a disputed foreign territory.
Appellants failed to provide sufficient evidence of sale transactions and dispatch of goods.
Non-compliance with Customs Act, 1969 export procedures invalidated the claim of zero-rated exports.
